translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Sudhā

analyzed: veyyā vacca kattheḥ a padāna  vipassissa bhagavataḥ
translated: The Elder Veyyāvacca’s Birth Story🔽“I was in the great assembly
of the Fortunate One Vipassī;
I was the one who did the announcing,
the one who was in charge of all the duties.
I had nothing to give
to the Sugata, the Great Seer;
I rubbed the Teacher’s feet,
with a mind full of faith.
For ninety-one eons,
I did the announcing;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the announcing.
And in the eighth past eon,
I was the King Sucintito;
I was endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Wheel-turning Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Veyyāvacca recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā veyyāvaccako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Veyyāvaccakattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā veyyāvaccakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽veyyāvaccakattherassa apadānam navama
translated: The Elder Veyyāvacca’s Birth Story is the ninth.
